alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 23 at 10:45PM AKST until January 24 at 10:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta. * WHEN...Until 10 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The worst conditions are occurring along the coast. Winds will slowly diminish tonight, which will allow for gradually improving conditions. Visibilities as low as one half mile are isolated, however still possible for inland locations across the Kuskokwim Delta, including Bethel. Northeasterly winds 20 to 30 mph will persist until Tuesday morning. Conditions will begin to improve by early Tuesday afternoon as winds start to diminish more quickly.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
